Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has enough water and light, showing it living and growing.
The student can draw a plant that does not have water, showing it not growing well or wilting.
The student can use their drawings to show that plants need water to live and grow.
The student can identify and draw patterns that show how plants react differently when given water versus when they are not.
The student can make comparisons using their drawings to describe that plants need more than just light to live and grow; they also need water.
